title: Nick Jonas says that his upcoming first wedding anniversary to Priyanka Chopra will be 'a bit more chill' compared to their 'blowout' nuptials
text:
Nick Jonas told Insider that his upcoming first wedding anniversary to Priyanka Chopra Jonas will likely be low-key compared to their 2018 nuptials.

"I have a few ideas of what I'd like to do and ways to make it special," Jonas, who's promoting his partnership with Cigna, told Insider. "But I think the wedding itself was quite the blowout, so we will probably be a bit more chill this time and see how it goes."

The singer added: "I'm looking forward to celebrating that day with her and hopefully be among friends and family as well."

Nick Jonas says that his upcoming first wedding anniversary to Priyanka Chopra Jonas will be "a bit more chill" compared to their lavish nuptials.

"I have a few ideas of what I'd like to do and ways to make it special," Jonas, who's promoting his partnership with Cigna, told Insider. "But I think the wedding itself was quite the blowout, so we will probably be a bit more chill this time and see how it goes."

The 27-year-old singer continued: "I'm looking forward to celebrating that day with her and hopefully be among friends and family as well."

Priyanka Chopra Jonas and Nick Jonas got married in 2018. Rajanish Kakade/AP

Jonas and Chopra Jonas tied the knot in December 2018 at Umaid Bhawan Palace in Jodhpur, Rajasthan, India.

The stars shared plenty of photos and videos from their pre-wedding parties, which included an epic pre-wedding song and dance party with Jonas and his family.

The couple was married during two extravagant ceremonies, a Christian service for Jonas' faith and a Hindu service to honor Chopra Jonas' background.

Read more: Nick Jonas credits his 'teammate' Priyanka Chopra with getting him on stage every night of his hectic tour

For the Western ceremony, the actress wore a custom-made Ralph Lauren gown that included a high-neck, floral and scroll motifs, and a 75-foot-long veil. Jonas' suit included a subtle nod to Chopra Jonas, as reported by People.

During the Hindu wedding the next day, Chopra Jonas wore a custom-made red dress by an Indian designer named Sabyasachi, which took 110 embroiderers a total of 3,720 hours to make.

The pair also cut into a seven-tier cake using a knife that was shaped like a sword. After getting married, they held several receptions to accommodate their friends and family in India and the US.

Since then, Chopra Jonas has weighed in on the celebrations.

Speaking to Elle UK, the actress said that she "splurged" on her wedding. While speaking at the Women in the World Summit in New York in April, Chopra Jonas said that "it all happened so fast" and they didn't realize how many things they had agreed to include in their wedding until it happened.

"We saw videos, and then the bill," she said. "And we were like, 'Oh, cool, cool, cool. Maybe we should have prepared this a little bit more.' So that's why it was that glorious. We weren't prepared."
